ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Intermediate Spanish vocab and grammar; aspects of various Latin American cultures
applying language skills to real world cultural topics; analyzing topics in Latin American culture
I certainly improved my Spanish and had the opportunity to do so through culture and not just grammar.
I advanced my spanish skills significantly, especially in written form. I learned about latin culture and society.
I learned about Spanish grammar and vocabulary while also learning about the culture, major problems and history of Latin American and Spanish speaking countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - content and professor
Weakness - disorganization/lack of clarity about assignment guidelines & due dates
I think this course did a great job of listening to feedback

strengths are that the material is engaging, it is low-stress because there are only two examinations which helps students learn more, and projects are fun ways to learn Spanish. weaknesses are that the course could explore a broader range of topics relating to Latin American culture and the short reflections seemed redundant and unnecessary.
The strength is in the move away from grammar drills that take up class time. The current course structure is really strong and engaging.

It is engaging and the professor is excellent. I think that the writing assignments and other coursework should be directed more towards real world problems or personal lives so that the subject matter feels more important and practical.
The course was immersive and enjoyable. A more structured guide on homework and what is due would be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes because it is a refreshing transition from L1 and L2 because there is less new grammar learning and more intense application.
Yes! Absolutely if you want to strengthen your Spanish.
Yes, especially with this professor, I loved her. I would recommend asking for as much structure and explicit direction as possible.
Yes I would. It was a great Spanish class.
